etymology.description: Pictogram: a flag on a pole with a decoration on top; in modern form the flag is detached and stylized as 方; related to 倝, unrelated to 朝; appears as 𭤨 as a side component, whose top is unrelated to 伤, 乞, 每.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicts a banner mounted on a pole with a finial, hence the meaning ‘flag’. In regular script the banner shape was abstracted to the square-like 方 element and, when used as a side component, takes the form 𭤨 that may resemble other parts but is etymologically distinct.

examples.chinese: 军营门口插着一面㫃(軍營門口插著一面㫃)。
examples.pinyin: Jūnyíng ménkǒu chāzhe yī miàn qí.
examples.english: A flag was raised at the entrance of the barracks.

examples.chinese: 风起时，㫃在高杆上猎猎作响(風起時，㫃在高桿上獵獵作響)。
examples.pinyin: Fēng qǐ shí, qí zài gāo gān shàng lièliè zuòxiǎng.
examples.english: When the wind rose, the flag fluttered loudly on the tall pole.

examples.chinese: 将军挥㫃下令进军(將軍揮㫃下令進軍)。
examples.english: The general waved the flag to order the advance.
